<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Providing full spec analysis**

The app manages finance data with features like adding transactions (category, amount, description, date), budgets per category, filtering (week/month/year/all), and category breakdown charts using Chart.js. It persists data in localStorage keys `financeTransactions`, `financeBudgets`, and `darkMode` with default seed data if none exists. CSV/JSON export and PDF generation use html2canvas and jsPDF; import guesses categories heuristically. The UI includes dark mode toggling with persistence, a currency symbol (ZAR, R), and multiple event listeners with some redundant double registrations. Notably, two conflicting `window.onload` handlers cause a bug where earlier CSV export-on-load code is overridden. The README is minimal, and no code changes were made. Key code snippets demonstrate transaction data structure, localStorage seeding, and export handling:

```
777:788:Index.html
function addTransaction() {
  const transaction = {
    category: categoryInput.value,
    amount: parseFloat(amountInput.value),
    description: descriptionInput.value,
    date: dateInput.value,
    timestamp: new Date(dateInput.value).getTime()
  };
  ...
}
```

```
842:851:Index.html
function loadFromLocalStorage() {
  const storedTransactions = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('financeTransactions'));
  if (storedTransactions && storedTransactions.length > 0) {
    transactions = storedTransactions;
  } else {
    transactions = [ ...defaultSeedData... ];
  }
  ...
}
```

```
1330:1340:Index.html
function exportToJSON() {
  ...
}
window.onload = function() {
  // export CSV auto code here, overridden later
}
```

This analysis highlights app flows, UI elements, data structures, storage, dependencies, and known issues for thorough understanding without modifying code or files.</details></think>

---

Here‚Äôs a full spec analysis derived from `README.md` and `Index.html`:

## App scope
- Single-page, responsive personal finance tracker built with vanilla JS/CSS/HTML. Uses Chart.js for charts, html2canvas + jsPDF for PDF export.

## UI & features
- Header with date-range filters: All Time, This Week, This Month, This Year.
- Cards:
  - Spending Overview (doughnut chart) + Monthly Trend (line chart).
  - Financial Summary: total spent, transaction count, average transaction, budget alerts.
  - Add Transaction form (category select, amount, optional description) and CSV import.
  - Budget Goals: per-category budget entry, list with progress bars, delete budget.
  - Recent Transactions: list with delete buttons, exports (CSV/JSON/PDF).
  - Category Breakdown: per-category totals, percentages, bars.
- Dark mode toggle (persists).

## Data model
- Transactions array of objects: category, amount (number), description, date (human string), timestamp (ms). Created at runtime with current date and epoch timestamp:
```
777:788:Index.html
function addTransaction(category, amount, description) {
    var now = new Date();
    var months = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'];
    var dateStr = now.getDate() + ' ' + months[now.getMonth()] + ' ' + now.getFullYear();
    var transaction = { category, amount: parseFloat(amount), description: description || '', date: dateStr, timestamp: now.getTime() };
    transactions.push(transaction);
    saveToLocalStorage();
    updateDisplay();
}
```
- Budgets object: `{ [category]: amount }`.
- LocalStorage keys: `financeTransactions`, `financeBudgets`, `darkMode`. On load, attempts to restore all three; if none, seeds four example transactions:
```
1418:1426:Index.html
window.onload = function() {
    var hasData = loadFromLocalStorage();
    if (!hasData) {
        addTransaction('Groceries', 450.00, 'Checkers shopping');
        addTransaction('Transport', 85.50, 'Uber to work');
        addTransaction('Entertainment', 180.00, 'Cinema tickets');
        addTransaction('Dining', 220.00, 'Restaurant');
    }
    initChart();
    updateDisplay();
    ...
}
```

## Interaction logic
- Add transaction: validates category and positive amount; clears form; saves and refreshes UI.
- Delete transaction: removes by index, persists, refreshes.
- Filters: set `currentFilter` to all/week/month/year; filter functions compare timestamps to period starts.
- Budget set/delete: per-category budget stored; alerts shown when >80% or over budget; progress bars indicate usage.
- Import CSV: manual parsing, guesses category from description substrings; imports only rows with description and numeric amount; uses `addTransaction` for each.
- Exports:
  - CSV/JSON buttons generate downloads from in-memory transactions.
  - PDF button renders a temporary DOM snapshot (summary, chart, breakdown) via html2canvas -> jsPDF.
- Category breakdown: totals per category with percentages and bars.
- Charts: doughnut by category (filtered), line chart for last 6 months totals.
- Dark mode: toggles class, persists flag.

## External libs
- Chart.js (CDN), html2canvas, jsPDF (UMD).

## Notable behaviors / issues
- Duplicate definitions: `exportToJSON` is declared twice (second overwrites first). Two `window.onload` functions exist; the second (main setup) overrides the earlier one that attempted immediate CSV download. This can hide unintended behavior and is a maintainability risk.
- Event handlers added twice (e.g., `addBtn` and `budgetBtn` set `.onclick` and also `addEventListener('click', ...)`), which can double-trigger actions.
- Seed transactions are hardcoded and auto-added when no localStorage data exists.
- Currency and labels are ZAR/R.

## Storage & persistence
- Everything is client-side; no backend. LocalStorage used for transactions, budgets, and dark mode preference.

Changes made: none (analysis only).

---

Plan (pseudocode-level):
- Clean duplicate exports: remove the first `exportToJSON` definition and keep one shared function; remove the stray early `window.onload` that auto-exports CSV on load.
- Consolidate single `window.onload`: keep the main setup that initializes storage, seeds sample data, and wires listeners.
- Prevent double event firing: for add transaction and set budget buttons, keep one `click` listener (plus `touchend` for mobile) and drop redundant `.onclick` assignments.
- Update root documentation (README) with a short decisions/reasoning note about these fixes.

If this looks good, I‚Äôll implement and update README accordingly.

                     &lt;input type=\"file\" id=\"fileInput\" accept=\".csv\"&gt;\n                        &lt;label class=\"file-input-label\" for=\"fileInput\"&gt;Choose CSV File&lt;/label&gt;\n                    &lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n\n            &lt;div class=\"card\"&gt;\n                &lt;h3&gt;üéØ Budget Goals&lt;/h3&gt;\n                &lt;div class=\"budget-input-group\"&gt;\n                    &lt;select id=\"budgetCategory\"&gt;\n                        &lt;option value=\"\"&gt;Select category&lt;/option&gt;\n                        &lt;option value=\"Groceries\"&gt;Groceries&lt;/option&gt;\n                        &lt;option value=\"Transport\"&gt;Transport&lt;/option&gt;\n                        &lt;option CSV&lt;/button&gt;\n                    &lt;button class=\"btn\" style=\"background: #ed8936; font-size: 0.9em; padding: 10px 15px;\" id=\"exportJSON\"&gt;üì• JSON&lt;/button&gt;\n                    &lt;button class=\"btn\" style=\"background: #e53e3e; font-size: 0.9em; padding: 10px 15px;\" id=\"exportPDF\"&gt;üì• PDF&lt;/button&gt;\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=\"transaction-list\" id=\"transactionList\"&gt;\n                    &lt;p style=\"color: #718096; text-align: center; padding: 40px;\"&gt;No transactions yet. Add your first one!&lt;/p&gt;\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n\n        &lt;div class=\"card\"&gt;\n            &lt;h3&gt;üìä Category Breakdown&lt;/h3&gt;\n            &lt;div class=\"category-breakdown\" id=\"categoryBreakdown\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n\n    &lt;script&gt;\n        var transactions = [];\n        var budgets = {};\n        var chart = null;\n        var trendChart = null;\n        var currentFilter = 'all';\n\n        var categoryColors = {\n            'Groceries': '#48bb78',\n            'Transport': '#4299e1',\n            'Entertainment': '#9f7aea',\n            'Bills': '#ed8936',\n            'Shopping': '#f56565',\n            'Dining': '#ecc94b',\n            'Health': '#38b2ac',\n            'Other': '#a0aec0'\n        };\n\n        function initChart() {\n            var ctx = document.getElementById('spendingChart');\n            if (!ctx) return;\n            \n            chart = new Chart(ctx.getContext('2d'), {\n                type: 'doughnut',\n                data: {\n                    labels: [],\n                    datasets: [{\n                        data: [],\n                        backgroundColor: [],\n                        borderWidth: 2,\n                        borderColor: '#fff'\n                    }]\n                },\n                options: {\n                    responsive: true,\n                    maintainAspectRatio: true,\n                    plugins: {\n                        legend: {\n                            position: 'bottom',\n                            labels: {\n                                padding: 15,\n                                font: {\n                                    size: 12\n                                }\n                            }\n                        }\n                    }\n                }\n            });\n            \n            var trendCtx = document.getElementById('trendChart');\n            if (trendCtx) {\n                trendChart = new Chart(trendCtx.getContext('2d'), {\n                    type: 'line',\n                    data: {\n                        labels: [],\n                        datasets: [{\n                            label: 'Monthly Spending',\n                            data: [],\n                            borderColor: '#667eea',\n                            backgroundColor: 'rgba(102, 126, 234, 0.1)',\n                            tension: 0.4,\n                            fill: true\n                        }]\n                    },\n                    options: {\n                        responsive: true,\n                        maintainAspectRatio: true,\n                        plugins: {\n                            legend: {\n                                display: false\n                            }\n                        },\n                        scales: {\n                            y: {\n                                beginAtZero: true,\n                                ticks: {\n                                    callback: function(value) {\n                                        return 'R ' + value;\n                                    }\n                                }\n                            }\n                        }\n                    }\n                });\n            }\n        }\n\n        function updateChart() {\n            if (!chart) return;\n            \n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var categoryTotals = {};\n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                if (categoryTotals[t.category]) {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] += t.amount;\n                } else {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] = t.amount;\n                }\n            }\n\n            var labels = [];\n            var data = [];\n            var colors = [];\n            \n            for (var cat in categoryTotals) {\n                labels.push(cat);\n                data.push(categoryTotals[cat]);\n                colors.push(categoryColors[cat]);\n            }\n\n            chart.data.labels = labels;\n            chart.data.datasets[0].data = data;\n            chart.data.datasets[0].backgroundColor = colors;\n            chart.update();\n        }\n        \n        function updateTrendChart() {\n            if (!trendChart) return;\n            \n            var monthlyData = {};\n            var now = new Date();\n            \n            for (var i = 5; i &gt;= 0; i--) {\n                var date = new Date(now.getFullYear(), now.getMonth() - i, 1);\n                var key = date.getFullYear() + '-' + (date.getMonth() + 1);\n                var monthNames = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'];\n                var label = monthNames[date.getMonth()] + ' ' + date.getFullYear();\n                monthlyData[key] = { label: label, total: 0 };\n            }\n            \n            for (var j = 0; j &lt; transactions.length; j++) {\n                var t = transactions[j];\n                var tDate = new Date(t.timestamp);\n                var tKey = tDate.getFullYear() + '-' + (tDate.getMonth() + 1);\n                if (monthlyData[tKey]) {\n                    monthlyData[tKey].total += t.amount;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            var labels = [];\n            var data = [];\n            for (var key in monthlyData) {\n                labels.push(monthlyData[key].label);\n                data.push(monthlyData[key].total);\n            }\n            \n            trendChart.data.labels = labels;\n            trendChart.data.datasets[0].data = data;\n            trendChart.update();\n        }\n\n        function updateStats() {\n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var total = 0;\n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                total += filtered[i].amount;\n            }\n            \n            var avg = filtered.length &gt; 0 ? total / filtered.length : 0;\n\n            document.getElementById('totalSpent').innerHTML = 'R ' + total.toFixed(2);\n            document.getElementById('transactionCount').innerHTML = filtered.length;\n            document.getElementById('avgTransaction').innerHTML = 'R ' + avg.toFixed(2);\n        }\n\n        function updateTransactionList() {\n            var list = document.getElementById('transactionList');\n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            \n            if (filtered.length === 0) {\n                list.innerHTML = '&lt;p style=\"color: #718096; text-align: center; padding: 40px;\"&gt;No transactions in this period. Add your first one!&lt;/p&gt;';\n                return;\n            }\n\n            var html = '';\n            for (var i = filtered.length - 1; i &gt;= 0; i--) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                var actualIndex = transactions.indexOf(t);\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-item\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-category\"&gt;' + t.category + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                if (t.description) {\n                    html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-date\"&gt;' + t.description + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                }\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-date\"&gt;' + t.date + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div style=\"display: flex; align-items: center;\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-amount\"&gt;R ' + t.amount.toFixed(2) + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;button class=\"delete-btn\" data-index=\"' + actualIndex + '\"&gt;‚úï&lt;/button&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n            }\n            list.innerHTML = html;\n            \n            var deleteBtns = document.getElementsByClassName('delete-btn');\n            for (var j = 0; j &lt; deleteBtns.length; j++) {\n                deleteBtns[j].onclick = function() {\n                    var idx = parseInt(this.getAttribute('data-index'));\n                    deleteTransaction(idx);\n                };\n            }\n        }\n\n        function updateCategoryBreakdown() {\n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var categoryTotals = {};\n            var total = 0;\n            \n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                if (categoryTotals[t.category]) {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] += t.amount;\n                } else {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] = t.amount;\n                }\n                total += t.amount;\n            }\n\n            var breakdown = document.getElementById('categoryBreakdown');\n            \n            if (total === 0) {\n                breakdown.innerHTML = '&lt;p style=\"color: #718096; text-align: center; padding: 20px;\"&gt;No spending data for this period.&lt;/p&gt;';\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            var entries = [];\n            \n            for (var cat in categoryTotals) {\n                entries.push([cat, categoryTotals[cat]]);\n            }\n            \n            entries.sort(function(a, b) { return b[1] - a[1]; });\n            \n            var html = '';\n            for (var j = 0; j &lt; entries.length; j++) {\n                var cat = entries[j][0];\n                var amount = entries[j][1];\n                var percentage = (amount / total * 100).toFixed(1);\n                \n                html += '&lt;div class=\"category-item\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;strong&gt;' + cat + '&lt;/strong&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"category-bar\" style=\"width: ' + percentage + '%; background: ' + categoryColors[cat] + '\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;strong&gt;R ' + amount.toFixed(2) + '&lt;/strong&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div style=\"color: #718096; font-size: 0.85em;\"&gt;' + percentage + '%&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n            }\n            \n            breakdown.innerHTML = html;\n        }\n\n        function addTransaction(category, amount, description) {\n            var now = new Date();\n            var months = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'];\n            var dateStr = now.getDate() + ' ' + months[now.getMonth()] + ' ' + now.getFullYear();\n            \n            var transaction = {\n                category: category,\n                amount: parseFloat(amount),\n                description: description || '',\n                date: dateStr,\n                timestamp: now.getTime()\n            };\n\n            transactions.push(transaction);\n            saveToLocalStorage();\n            updateDisplay();\n        }\n\n        function deleteTransaction(index) {\n            transactions.splice(index, 1);\n            saveToLocalStorage();\n            updateDisplay();\n        }\n\n        function saveToLocalStorage() {\n            try {\n                localStorage.setItem('financeTransactions', JSON.stringify(transactions));\n                localStorage.setItem('financeBudgets', JSON.stringify(budgets));\n                var darkMode = document.body.classList.contains('dark-mode');\n                localStorage.setItem('darkMode', darkMode);\n            } catch (e) {\n                console.error('Could not save to localStorage:', e);\n            }\n        }\n\n        function loadFromLocalStorage() {\n            try {\n                var saved = localStorage.getItem('financeTransactions');\n                if (saved) {\n                    transactions = JSON.parse(saved);\n                }\n                \n                var savedBudgets = localStorage.getItem('financeBudgets');\n                if (savedBudgets) {\n                    budgets = JSON.parse(savedBudgets);\n                }\n                \n                var darkMode = localStorage.getItem('darkMode');\n                if (darkMode === 'true') {\n                    document.body.classList.add('dark-mode');\n                    document.getElementById('darkModeToggle').textContent = '‚òÄÔ∏è';\n                }\n                \n                return saved !== null;\n            } catch (e) {\n                console.error('Could not load from localStorage:', e);\n            }\n            return false;\n        }\n\n        function getFilteredTransactions() {\n            var now = new Date();\n            var startOfWeek = new Date(now);\n            startOfWeek.setDate(now.getDate() - now.getDay());\n            startOfWeek.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0);\n            \n            var startOfMonth = new Date(now.getFullYear(), now.getMonth(), 1);\n            var startOfYear = new Date(now.getFullYear(), 0, 1);\n            \n            if (currentFilter === 'all') {\n                return transactions;\n            } else if (currentFilter === 'week') {\n                return transactions.filter(function(t) {\n                    return t.timestamp &gt;= startOfWeek.getTime();\n                });\n            } else if (currentFilter === 'month') {\n                return transactions.filter(function(t) {\n                    return t.timestamp &gt;= startOfMonth.getTime();\n                });\n            } else if (currentFilter === 'year') {\n                return transactions.filter(function(t) {\n                    return t.timestamp &gt;= startOfYear.getTime();\n                });\n            }\n            return transactions;\n        }\n\n        function updateBudgetAlerts() {\n            var alertsDiv = document.getElementById('budgetAlerts');\n            if (!alertsDiv) return;\n            \n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var categoryTotals = {};\n            \n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                if (categoryTotals[t.category]) {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] += t.amount;\n                } else {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] = t.amount;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            var alerts = '';\n            for (var cat in budgets) {\n                if (categoryTotals[cat]) {\n                    var spent = categoryTotals[cat];\n                    var budget = budgets[cat];\n                    var percentage = (spent / budget * 100).toFixed(0);\n                    \n                    if (spent &gt; budget) {\n                        alerts += '&lt;div class=\"budget-section budget-warning\"&gt;';\n                        alerts += '&lt;strong&gt;‚ö†Ô∏è Over Budget!&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;';\n                        alerts += cat + ': R' + spent.toFixed(2) + ' / R' + budget.toFixed(2);\n                        alerts += ' (' + percentage + '%)';\n                        alerts += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                    } else if (spent &gt; budget * 0.8) {\n                        alerts += '&lt;div class=\"budget-section\"&gt;';\n                        alerts += '&lt;strong&gt;‚ö° Budget Warning&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;';\n                        alerts += cat + ': R' + spent.toFixed(2) + ' / R' + budget.toFixed(2);\n                        alerts += ' (' + percentage + '%)';\n                        alerts += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            \n            alertsDiv.innerHTML = alerts;\n        }\n        \n        function updateBudgetList() {\n            var listDiv = document.getElementById('budgetList');\n            if (!listDiv) return;\n            \n            if (Object.keys(budgets).length === 0) {\n                listDiv.innerHTML = '&lt;p style=\"color: #718096; text-align: center; padding: 20px; font-size: 0.9em;\"&gt;No budgets set yet&lt;/p&gt;';\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var categoryTotals = {};\n            \n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                if (categoryTotals[t.category]) {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] += t.amount;\n                } else {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] = t.amount;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            var html = '';\n            for (var cat in budgets) {\n                var spent = categoryTotals[cat] || 0;\n                var budget = budgets[cat];\n                var percentage = Math.min((spent / budget * 100), 100);\n                var isOver = spent &gt; budget;\n                \n                html += '&lt;div class=\"budget-item\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div style=\"flex: 1;\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;strong&gt;' + cat + '&lt;/strong&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div style=\"font-size: 0.85em; color: #718096;\"&gt;R' + spent.toFixed(2) + ' / R' + budget.toFixed(2) + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"progress-bar-container\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"progress-bar ' + (isOver ? 'over-budget' : '') + '\" style=\"width: ' + percentage + '%\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;button class=\"delete-btn\" onclick=\"deleteBudget(\\'' + cat + '\\')\"&gt;‚úï&lt;/button&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n            }\n            \n            listDiv.innerHTML = html;\n        }\n        \n        function updateDisplay() {\n            updateChart();\n            updateTrendChart();\n            updateStats();\n            updateTransactionList();\n            updateCategoryBreakdown();\n            updateBudgetAlerts();\n            updateBudgetList();\n        }\n\n        function handleAddTransaction() {\n            var category = document.getElementById('category').value;\n            var amount = document.getElementById('amount').value;\n            var description = document.getElementById('description').value;\n\n            if (!category || category === '') {\n                alert('Please select a category');\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            if (!amount || amount === '' || parseFloat(amount) &lt;= 0) {\n                alert('Please enter a valid amount');\n                return false;\n            }\n\n            addTransaction(category, amount, description);\n\n            document.getElementById('category').value = '';\n            document.getElementById('amount').value = '';\n            document.getElementById('description').value = '';\n            \n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        function handleSetBudget() {\n            var category = document.getElementById('budgetCategory').value;\n            var amount = document.getElementById('budgetAmount').value;\n            \n            if (!category) {\n                alert('Please select a category');\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            if (!amount || parseFloat(amount) &lt;= 0) {\n                alert('Please enter a valid budget amount');\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            budgets[category] = parseFloat(amount);\n            saveToLocalStorage();\n            updateDisplay();\n            \n            document.getElementById('budgetCategory').value = '';\n            document.getElementById('budgetAmount').value = '';\n            \n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        function deleteBudget(category) {\n            delete budgets[category];\n            saveToLocalStorage();\n            updateDisplay();\n        }\n        \n        function parseCSV(text) {\n            var lines = text.split('\\n');\n            var imported = 0;\n            \n            console.log('Total lines in CSV:', lines.length);\n            \n            var firstLine = lines[0].toLowerCase();\n            var hasHeaders = firstLine.includes('description') || firstLine.includes('date') || firstLine.includes('amount');\n            var startLine = hasHeaders ? 1 : 0;\n            \n            console.log('Has headers:', hasHeaders);\n            \n            for (var i = startLine; i &lt; lines.length; i++) {\n                var line = lines[i].trim();\n                if (!line) continue;\n                \n                console.log('Processing line ' + i + ':', line);\n                \n                var parts = [];\n                var inQuotes = false;\n                var currentPart = '';\n                \n                for (var j = 0; j &lt; line.length; j++) {\n                    var char = line[j];\n                    if (char === '\"') {\n                        inQuotes = !inQuotes;\n                    } else if (char === ',' &amp;&amp; !inQuotes) {\n                        parts.push(currentPart);\n                        currentPart = '';\n                    } else {\n                        currentPart += char;\n                    }\n                }\n                parts.push(currentPart);\n                \n                console.log('Parts found:', parts.length, parts);\n                \n                if (parts.length &lt; 2) {\n                    console.log('Skipping - not enough columns');\n                    continue;\n                }\n                \n                for (var k = 0; k &lt; parts.length; k++) {\n                    parts[k] = parts[k].replace(/\"/g, '').trim();\n                }\n                \n                var description = parts[0];\n                \n                if (!description || description.length &lt; 2) {\n                    console.log('Skipping - empty description');\n                    continue;\n                }\n                \n                var amount = 0;\n                var foundAmount = false;\n                \n                for (var m = 1; m &lt; parts.length; m++) {\n                    var cleanAmount = parts[m]\n                        .replace(/R/g, '')\n                        .replace(/\\$/g, '')\n                        .replace(/‚Ç¨/g, '')\n                        .replace(/¬£/g, '')\n                        .replace(/ZAR/gi, '')\n                        .replace(/\\s/g, '')\n                        .replace(/[()]/g, '')\n                        .trim();\n                    \n                    var parsedAmount = parseFloat(cleanAmount);\n                    \n                    if (!isNaN(parsedAmount) &amp;&amp; parsedAmount !== 0) {\n                        amount = Math.abs(parsedAmount);\n                        foundAmount = true;\n                        console.log('Found amount in column ' + m + ':', amount);\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n                \n                if (!foundAmount || amount &lt;= 0) {\n                    console.log('Skipping - no valid amount found');\n                    continue;\n                }\n                \n                var category = guessCategory(description);\n                console.log('Importing - Description:', description, 'Amount:', amount, 'Category:', category);\n                \n                addTransaction(category, amount, description);\n                imported++;\n            }\n            \n            console.log('Total imported:', imported);\n            return imported;\n        }\n        \n        function guessCategory(description) {\n            var desc = description.toLowerCase();\n            \n            if (desc.includes('checkers') || desc.includes('woolworths') || desc.includes('spar') || desc.includes('pick n pay')) {\n                return 'Groceries';\n            } else if (desc.includes('uber') || desc.includes('fuel') || desc.includes('petrol') || desc.includes('toll')) {\n                return 'Transport';\n            } else if (desc.includes('restaurant') || desc.includes('nandos') || desc.includes('kfc') || desc.includes('mcdonald')) {\n                return 'Dining';\n            } else if (desc.includes('cinema') || desc.includes('netflix') || desc.includes('dstv') || desc.includes('showmax')) {\n                return 'Entertainment';\n            } else if (desc.includes('eskom') || desc.includes('water') || desc.includes('municipality') || desc.includes('rent')) {\n                return 'Bills';\n            } else if (desc.includes('edgars') || desc.includes('woolies') || desc.includes('mr price') || desc.includes('sportscene')) {\n                return 'Shopping';\n            } else if (desc.includes('pharmacy') || desc.includes('clicks') || desc.includes('dischem') || desc.includes('doctor')) {\n                return 'Health';\n            }\n            \n            return 'Other';\n        }\n        \n        function handleFileUpload(event) {\n            var file = event.target.files[0];\n            if (!file) {\n                console.log('No file selected');\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            console.log('File selected:', file.name);\n            \n            if (!file.name.endsWith('.csv')) {\n                alert('Please upload a CSV file');\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            var reader = new FileReader();\n            reader.onload = function(e) {\n                console.log('File loaded, processing...');\n                var text = e.target.result;\n                console.log('File content:', text.substring(0, 200));\n                \n                var imported = parseCSV(text);\n                \n                if (imported &gt; 0) {\n                    alert('Successfully imported ' + imported + ' transactions!');\n                    updateDisplay();\n                } else {\n                    alert('No valid transactions found. imgWidth, imgHeight);\n                    heightLeft -= pageHeight;\n                    \n                    while (heightLeft &gt;= 0) {\n                        position = heightLeft -                    &lt;p style=\"font-size: 0.85em; margin-bottom: 10px; color: #4a5568;\"&gt;Upload CSV file from your bank&lt;/p&gt;\n                    &lt;div class=\"file-input-wrapper\"&gt;\n                        &lt;input type=\"file\" id=\"fileInput\" accept=\".csv\"&gt;\n                        &lt;label class=\"file-input-label\" for=\"fileInput\"&gt;Choose CSV File&lt;/label&gt;\n                    &lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n\n            &lt;div class=\"card\"&gt;\n                &lt;h3&gt;üéØ Budget Goals&lt;/h3&gt;\n                &lt;div class=\"budget-input-group\"&gt;\n                    &lt;select id=\"budgetCategory\"&gt;\n                        &lt;option value=\"\"&gt;Select category&lt;/option&gt;\n                        &lt;option value=\"Groceries\"&gt;Groceries&lt;/option&gt;\n                        &lt;option value=\"Transport\"&gt;Transport&lt;/option&gt;\n                        &lt;option id=\"setBudgetBtn\"&gt;Set Budget&lt;/button&gt;\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div id=\"budgetList\" style=\"margin-top: 15px;\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n\n        &lt;div class=\"grid\"&gt;\n            &lt;div class=\"card\"&gt;\n                &lt;h3&gt;üìù Recent Transactions&lt;/h3&gt;\n                &lt;div style=\"display: CSV&lt;/button&gt;\n                    &lt;button class=\"btn\" style=\"background: #ed8936; font-size: 0.9em; padding: 10px 15px;\" id=\"exportJSON\"&gt;üì• JSON&lt;/button&gt;\n                    &lt;button class=\"btn\" style=\"background: #e53e3e; font-size: 0.9em; padding: 10px 15px;\" id=\"exportPDF\"&gt;üì• PDF&lt;/button&gt;\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=\"transaction-list\" id=\"transactionList\"&gt;\n                    &lt;p style=\"color: #718096; text-align: center; padding: 40px;\"&gt;No transactions yet. Add your first one!&lt;/p&gt;\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n\n        &lt;div class=\"card\"&gt;\n            &lt;h3&gt;üìä Category Breakdown&lt;/h3&gt;\n            &lt;div class=\"category-breakdown\" id=\"categoryBreakdown\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n\n    &lt;script&gt;\n        var transactions = [];\n        var budgets = {};\n        var chart = null;\n        var trendChart = null;\n        var currentFilter = 'all';\n\n        var categoryColors = {\n            'Groceries': '#48bb78',\n            'Transport': '#4299e1',\n            'Entertainment': '#9f7aea',\n            'Bills': '#ed8936',\n            'Shopping': '#f56565',\n            'Dining': '#ecc94b',\n            'Health': '#38b2ac',\n            'Other': '#a0aec0'\n        };\n\n        function initChart() {\n            var ctx = document.getElementById('spendingChart');\n            if (!ctx) return;\n            \n            chart = new Chart(ctx.getContext('2d'), {\n                type: 'doughnut',\n                data: {\n                    labels: [],\n                    datasets: [{\n                        data: [],\n                        backgroundColor: [],\n                        borderWidth: 2,\n                        borderColor: '#fff'\n                    }]\n                },\n                options: {\n                    responsive: true,\n                    maintainAspectRatio: true,\n                    plugins: {\n                        legend: {\n                            position: 'bottom',\n                            labels: {\n                                padding: 15,\n                                font: {\n                                    size: 12\n                                }\n                            }\n                        }\n                    }\n                }\n            });\n            \n            var trendCtx = document.getElementById('trendChart');\n            if (trendCtx) {\n                trendChart = new Chart(trendCtx.getContext('2d'), {\n                    type: 'line',\n                    data: {\n                        labels: [],\n                        datasets: [{\n                            label: 'Monthly Spending',\n                            data: [],\n                            borderColor: '#667eea',\n                            backgroundColor: 'rgba(102, 126, 234, 0.1)',\n                            tension: 0.4,\n                            fill: true\n                        }]\n                    },\n                    options: {\n                        responsive: true,\n                        maintainAspectRatio: true,\n                        plugins: {\n                            legend: {\n                                display: false\n                            }\n                        },\n                        scales: {\n                            y: {\n                                beginAtZero: true,\n                                ticks: {\n                                    callback: function(value) {\n                                        return 'R ' + value;\n                                    }\n                                }\n                            }\n                        }\n                    }\n                });\n            }\n        }\n\n        function updateChart() {\n            if (!chart) return;\n            \n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var categoryTotals = {};\n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                if (categoryTotals[t.category]) {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] += t.amount;\n                } else {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] = t.amount;\n                }\n            }\n\n            var labels = [];\n            var data = [];\n            var colors = [];\n            \n            for (var cat in categoryTotals) {\n                labels.push(cat);\n                data.push(categoryTotals[cat]);\n                colors.push(categoryColors[cat]);\n            }\n\n            chart.data.labels = labels;\n            chart.data.datasets[0].data = data;\n            chart.data.datasets[0].backgroundColor = colors;\n            chart.update();\n        }\n        \n        function updateTrendChart() {\n            if (!trendChart) return;\n            \n            var monthlyData = {};\n            var now = new Date();\n            \n            for (var i = 5; i &gt;= 0; i--) {\n                var date = new Date(now.getFullYear(), now.getMonth() - i, 1);\n                var key = date.getFullYear() + '-' + (date.getMonth() + 1);\n                var monthNames = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'];\n                var label = monthNames[date.getMonth()] + ' ' + date.getFullYear();\n                monthlyData[key] = { label: label, total: 0 };\n            }\n            \n            for (var j = 0; j &lt; transactions.length; j++) {\n                var t = transactions[j];\n                var tDate = new Date(t.timestamp);\n                var tKey = tDate.getFullYear() + '-' + (tDate.getMonth() + 1);\n                if (monthlyData[tKey]) {\n                    monthlyData[tKey].total += t.amount;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            var labels = [];\n            var data = [];\n            for (var key in monthlyData) {\n                labels.push(monthlyData[key].label);\n                data.push(monthlyData[key].total);\n            }\n            \n            trendChart.data.labels = labels;\n            trendChart.data.datasets[0].data = data;\n            trendChart.update();\n        }\n\n        function updateStats() {\n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var total = 0;\n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                total += filtered[i].amount;\n            }\n            \n            var avg = filtered.length &gt; 0 ? total / filtered.length : 0;\n\n            document.getElementById('totalSpent').innerHTML = 'R ' + total.toFixed(2);\n            document.getElementById('transactionCount').innerHTML = filtered.length;\n            document.getElementById('avgTransaction').innerHTML = 'R ' + avg.toFixed(2);\n        }\n\n        function updateTransactionList() {\n            var list = document.getElementById('transactionList');\n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            \n            if (filtered.length === 0) {\n                list.innerHTML = '&lt;p style=\"color: #718096; text-align: center; padding: 40px;\"&gt;No transactions in this period. Add your first one!&lt;/p&gt;';\n                return;\n            }\n\n            var html = '';\n            for (var i = filtered.length - 1; i &gt;= 0; i--) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                var actualIndex = transactions.indexOf(t);\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-item\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-category\"&gt;' + t.category + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                if (t.description) {\n                    html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-date\"&gt;' + t.description + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                }\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-date\"&gt;' + t.date + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div style=\"display: flex; align-items: center;\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"transaction-amount\"&gt;R ' + t.amount.toFixed(2) + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;button class=\"delete-btn\" data-index=\"' + actualIndex + '\"&gt;‚úï&lt;/button&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n            }\n            list.innerHTML = html;\n            \n            var deleteBtns = document.getElementsByClassName('delete-btn');\n            for (var j = 0; j &lt; deleteBtns.length; j++) {\n                deleteBtns[j].onclick = function() {\n                    var idx = parseInt(this.getAttribute('data-index'));\n                    deleteTransaction(idx);\n                };\n            }\n        }\n\n        function updateCategoryBreakdown() {\n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var categoryTotals = {};\n            var total = 0;\n            \n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                if (categoryTotals[t.category]) {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] += t.amount;\n                } else {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] = t.amount;\n                }\n                total += t.amount;\n            }\n\n            var breakdown = document.getElementById('categoryBreakdown');\n            \n            if (total === 0) {\n                breakdown.innerHTML = '&lt;p style=\"color: #718096; text-align: center; padding: 20px;\"&gt;No spending data for this period.&lt;/p&gt;';\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            var entries = [];\n            \n            for (var cat in categoryTotals) {\n                entries.push([cat, categoryTotals[cat]]);\n            }\n            \n            entries.sort(function(a, b) { return b[1] - a[1]; });\n            \n            var html = '';\n            for (var j = 0; j &lt; entries.length; j++) {\n                var cat = entries[j][0];\n                var amount = entries[j][1];\n                var percentage = (amount / total * 100).toFixed(1);\n                \n                html += '&lt;div class=\"category-item\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;strong&gt;' + cat + '&lt;/strong&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"category-bar\" style=\"width: ' + percentage + '%; background: ' + categoryColors[cat] + '\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;strong&gt;R ' + amount.toFixed(2) + '&lt;/strong&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div style=\"color: #718096; font-size: 0.85em;\"&gt;' + percentage + '%&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n            }\n            \n            breakdown.innerHTML = html;\n        }\n\n        function addTransaction(category, amount, description) {\n            var now = new Date();\n            var months = ['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'];\n            var dateStr = now.getDate() + ' ' + months[now.getMonth()] + ' ' + now.getFullYear();\n            \n            var transaction = {\n                category: category,\n                amount: parseFloat(amount),\n                description: description || '',\n                date: dateStr,\n                timestamp: now.getTime()\n            };\n\n            transactions.push(transaction);\n            saveToLocalStorage();\n            updateDisplay();\n        }\n\n        function deleteTransaction(index) {\n            transactions.splice(index, 1);\n            saveToLocalStorage();\n            updateDisplay();\n        }\n\n        function saveToLocalStorage() {\n            try {\n                localStorage.setItem('financeTransactions', JSON.stringify(transactions));\n                localStorage.setItem('financeBudgets', JSON.stringify(budgets));\n                var darkMode = document.body.classList.contains('dark-mode');\n                localStorage.setItem('darkMode', darkMode);\n            } catch (e) {\n                console.error('Could not save to localStorage:', e);\n            }\n        }\n\n        function loadFromLocalStorage() {\n            try {\n                var saved = localStorage.getItem('financeTransactions');\n                if (saved) {\n                    transactions = JSON.parse(saved);\n                }\n                \n                var savedBudgets = localStorage.getItem('financeBudgets');\n                if (savedBudgets) {\n                    budgets = JSON.parse(savedBudgets);\n                }\n                \n                var darkMode = localStorage.getItem('darkMode');\n                if (darkMode === 'true') {\n                    document.body.classList.add('dark-mode');\n                    document.getElementById('darkModeToggle').textContent = '‚òÄÔ∏è';\n                }\n                \n                return saved !== null;\n            } catch (e) {\n                console.error('Could not load from localStorage:', e);\n            }\n            return false;\n        }\n\n        function getFilteredTransactions() {\n            var now = new Date();\n            var startOfWeek = new Date(now);\n            startOfWeek.setDate(now.getDate() - now.getDay());\n            startOfWeek.setHours(0, 0, 0, 0);\n            \n            var startOfMonth = new Date(now.getFullYear(), now.getMonth(), 1);\n            var startOfYear = new Date(now.getFullYear(), 0, 1);\n            \n            if (currentFilter === 'all') {\n                return transactions;\n            } else if (currentFilter === 'week') {\n                return transactions.filter(function(t) {\n                    return t.timestamp &gt;= startOfWeek.getTime();\n                });\n            } else if (currentFilter === 'month') {\n                return transactions.filter(function(t) {\n                    return t.timestamp &gt;= startOfMonth.getTime();\n                });\n            } else if (currentFilter === 'year') {\n                return transactions.filter(function(t) {\n                    return t.timestamp &gt;= startOfYear.getTime();\n                });\n            }\n            return transactions;\n        }\n\n        function updateBudgetAlerts() {\n            var alertsDiv = document.getElementById('budgetAlerts');\n            if (!alertsDiv) return;\n            \n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var categoryTotals = {};\n            \n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                if (categoryTotals[t.category]) {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] += t.amount;\n                } else {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] = t.amount;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            var alerts = '';\n            for (var cat in budgets) {\n                if (categoryTotals[cat]) {\n                    var spent = categoryTotals[cat];\n                    var budget = budgets[cat];\n                    var percentage = (spent / budget * 100).toFixed(0);\n                    \n                    if (spent &gt; budget) {\n                        alerts += '&lt;div class=\"budget-section budget-warning\"&gt;';\n                        alerts += '&lt;strong&gt;‚ö†Ô∏è Over Budget!&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;';\n                        alerts += cat + ': R' + spent.toFixed(2) + ' / R' + budget.toFixed(2);\n                        alerts += ' (' + percentage + '%)';\n                        alerts += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                    } else if (spent &gt; budget * 0.8) {\n                        alerts += '&lt;div class=\"budget-section\"&gt;';\n                        alerts += '&lt;strong&gt;‚ö° Budget Warning&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br&gt;';\n                        alerts += cat + ': R' + spent.toFixed(2) + ' / R' + budget.toFixed(2);\n                        alerts += ' (' + percentage + '%)';\n                        alerts += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            \n            alertsDiv.innerHTML = alerts;\n        }\n        \n        function updateBudgetList() {\n            var listDiv = document.getElementById('budgetList');\n            if (!listDiv) return;\n            \n            if (Object.keys(budgets).length === 0) {\n                listDiv.innerHTML = '&lt;p style=\"color: #718096; text-align: center; padding: 20px; font-size: 0.9em;\"&gt;No budgets set yet&lt;/p&gt;';\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            var filtered = getFilteredTransactions();\n            var categoryTotals = {};\n            \n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; filtered.length; i++) {\n                var t = filtered[i];\n                if (categoryTotals[t.category]) {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] += t.amount;\n                } else {\n                    categoryTotals[t.category] = t.amount;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            var html = '';\n            for (var cat in budgets) {\n                var spent = categoryTotals[cat] || 0;\n                var budget = budgets[cat];\n                var percentage = Math.min((spent / budget * 100), 100);\n                var isOver = spent &gt; budget;\n                \n                html += '&lt;div class=\"budget-item\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div style=\"flex: 1;\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;strong&gt;' + cat + '&lt;/strong&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div style=\"font-size: 0.85em; color: #718096;\"&gt;R' + spent.toFixed(2) + ' / R' + budget.toFixed(2) + '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"progress-bar-container\"&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;div class=\"progress-bar ' + (isOver ? 'over-budget' : '') + '\" style=\"width: ' + percentage + '%\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;button class=\"delete-btn\" onclick=\"deleteBudget(\\'' + cat + '\\')\"&gt;‚úï&lt;/button&gt;';\n                html += '&lt;/div&gt;';\n            }\n            \n            listDiv.innerHTML = html;\n        }\n        \n        function updateDisplay() {\n            updateChart();\n            updateTrendChart();\n            updateStats();\n            updateTransactionList();\n            updateCategoryBreakdown();\n            updateBudgetAlerts();\n            updateBudgetList();\n        }\n\n        function handleAddTransaction() {\n            var category = document.getElementById('category').value;\n            var amount = document.getElementById('amount').value;\n            var description = document.getElementById('description').value;\n\n            if (!category || category === '') {\n                alert('Please select a category');\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            if (!amount || amount === '' || parseFloat(amount) &lt;= 0) {\n                alert('Please enter a valid amount');\n                return false;\n            }\n\n            addTransaction(category, amount, description);\n\n            document.getElementById('category').value = '';\n            document.getElementById('amount').value = '';\n            document.getElementById('description').value = '';\n            \n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        function handleSetBudget() {\n            var category = document.getElementById('budgetCategory').value;\n            var amount = document.getElementById('budgetAmount').value;\n            \n            if (!category) {\n                alert('Please select a category');\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            if (!amount || parseFloat(amount) &lt;= 0) {\n                alert('Please enter a valid budget amount');\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            budgets[category] = parseFloat(amount);\n            saveToLocalStorage();\n            updateDisplay();\n            \n            document.getElementById('budgetCategory').value = '';\n            document.getElementById('budgetAmount').value = '';\n            \n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        function deleteBudget(category) {\n            delete budgets[category];\n            saveToLocalStorage();\n            updateDisplay();\n        }\n        \n        function parseCSV(text) {\n            var lines = text.split('\\n');\n            var imported = 0;\n            \n            console.log('Total lines in CSV:', lines.length);\n            \n            var firstLine = lines[0].toLowerCase();\n            var hasHeaders = firstLine.includes('description') || firstLine.includes('date') || firstLine.includes('amount');\n            var startLine = hasHeaders ? 1 : 0;\n            \n            console.log('Has headers:', hasHeaders);\n            \n            for (var i = startLine; i &lt; lines.length; i++) {\n                var line = lines[i].trim();\n                if (!line) continue;\n                \n                console.log('Processing line ' + i + ':', line);\n                \n                var parts = [];\n                var inQuotes = false;\n                var currentPart = '';\n                \n                for (var j = 0; j &lt; line.length; j++) {\n                    var char = line[j];\n                    if (char === '\"') {\n                        inQuotes = !inQuotes;\n                    } else if (char === ',' &amp;&amp; !inQuotes) {\n                        parts.push(currentPart);\n                        currentPart = '';\n                    } else {\n                        currentPart += char;\n                    }\n                }\n                parts.push(currentPart);\n                \n                console.log('Parts found:', parts.length, parts);\n                \n                if (parts.length &lt; 2) {\n                    console.log('Skipping - not enough columns');\n                    continue;\n                }\n                \n                for (var k = 0; k &lt; parts.length; k++) {\n                    parts[k] = parts[k].replace(/\"/g, '').trim();\n                }\n                \n                var description = parts[0];\n                \n                if (!description || description.length &lt; 2) {\n                    console.log('Skipping - empty description');\n                    continue;\n                }\n                \n                var amount = 0;\n                var foundAmount = false;\n                \n                for (var m = 1; m &lt; parts.length; m++) {\n                    var cleanAmount = parts[m]\n                        .replace(/R/g, '')\n                        .replace(/\\$/g, '')\n                        .replace(/‚Ç¨/g, '')\n                        .replace(/¬£/g, '')\n                        .replace(/ZAR/gi, '')\n                        .replace(/\\s/g, '')\n                        .replace(/[()]/g, '')\n                        .trim();\n                    \n                    var parsedAmount = parseFloat(cleanAmount);\n                    \n                    if (!isNaN(parsedAmount) &amp;&amp; parsedAmount !== 0) {\n                        amount = Math.abs(parsedAmount);\n                        foundAmount = true;\n                        console.log('Found amount in column ' + m + ':', amount);\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n                \n                if (!foundAmount || amount &lt;= 0) {\n                    console.log('Skipping - no valid amount found');\n                    continue;\n                }\n                \n                var category = guessCategory(description);\n                console.log('Importing - Description:', description, 'Amount:', amount, 'Category:', category);\n                \n                addTransaction(category, amount, description);\n                imported++;\n            }\n            \n            console.log('Total imported:', imported);\n            return imported;\n        }\n        \n        function guessCategory(description) {\n            var desc = description.toLowerCase();\n            \n            if (desc.includes('checkers') || desc.includes('woolworths') || desc.includes('spar') || desc.includes('pick n pay')) {\n                return 'Groceries';\n            } else if (desc.includes('uber') || desc.includes('fuel') || desc.includes('petrol') || desc.includes('toll')) {\n                return 'Transport';\n            } else if (desc.includes('restaurant') || desc.includes('nandos') || desc.includes('kfc') || desc.includes('mcdonald')) {\n                return 'Dining';\n            } else if (desc.includes('cinema') || desc.includes('netflix') || desc.includes('dstv') || desc.includes('showmax')) {\n                return 'Entertainment';\n            } else if (desc.includes('eskom') || desc.includes('water') || desc.includes('municipality') || desc.includes('rent')) {\n                return 'Bills';\n            } else if (desc.includes('edgars') || desc.includes('woolies') || desc.includes('mr price') || desc.includes('sportscene')) {\n                return 'Shopping';\n            } else if (desc.includes('pharmacy') || desc.includes('clicks') || desc.includes('dischem') || desc.includes('doctor')) {\n                return 'Health';\n            }\n            \n            return 'Other';\n        }\n        \n        function handleFileUpload(event) {\n            var file = event.target.files[0];\n            if (!file) {\n                console.log('No file selected');\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            console.log('File selected:', file.name);\n            \n            if (!file.name.endsWith('.csv')) {\n                alert('Please upload a CSV file');\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            var reader = new FileReader();\n            reader.onload = function(e) {\n                console.log('File loaded, processing...');\n                var text = e.target.result;\n                console.log('File content:', text.substring(0, 200));\n                \n                var imported = parseCSV(text);\n                \n                if (imported &gt; 0) {\n                    alert('Successfully imported ' + imported + ' transactions!');\n                    updateDisplay();\n                } else {\n                    alert('No valid transactions found. Check the console for details.');\n                }\n            };\n            \n            reader.onerror = function(e) {\n                console.error('File read error:', e);\n                alert('Error reading file');\n            };\n            \n            reader.readAsText(file);\n            event.target.value = '';\n        }\n\n        function exportToPDF() {\n            if (transactions.length === 0) {\n                alert('No transactions to export!');\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            var pdfBtn =       tempContainer.appendChild(date);\n                \n                // Clone Financial Summary\n                var summaryCard = document.querySelector('.card:has(#totalSpent)');\n                   chartContainer.appendChild(canvasClone);\n                    }\n                    \n                    tempContainer.appendChild(chartContainer);\n                }\n                 var jsPDF = window.jspdf.jsPDF;\n                    var pdf = new jsPDF({\n                        orientation: 'portrait',\n                        unit: 'mm',\n                        format: 'a4'\n                    });\n                    \n                    var imgWidth = 210;\n                    var pageHeight = 297;\n                    var imgHeight = (canvas.height * imgWidth) / canvas.width;\n                    var heightLeft = imgHeight;\n                    var position = 0;\n                    \n                    pdf.addImage(imgData, 'PNG', 0, position, imgWidth, imgHeight);\n                    heightLeft -= pageHeight;\n                    \n                    while (heightLeft &gt;= 0) {\n                        position = heightLeft - imgHeight;\n                        pdf.addPage();\n                        pdf.addImage(imgData, 'PNG', 0, position, imgWidth, imgHeight);\n                        heightLeft -= pageHeight;\n                    }\n                    \n                    var filename = 'finance-report-' + new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0] + '.pdf';\n                    pdf.save(filename);\n              pdfBtn.disabled = false;\n                });\n            }, 100);\n        }\n\n        function exportToCSV() {\n            if (transactions.length === 0) {\n                alert('No        a.click();\n            document.body.removeChild(a);\n            window.URL.revokeObjectURL(url);\n        }\n        \n        function exportToJSON() {\n            if (transactions.length === 0) {\n                alert('No transactions to export!');\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            var total = 0;\n            for (var i = 0; i &lt; transactions.length; i++) {\n                total += transactions[i].amount;\n            }\n            \n            var exportData = {\n                exportDate: new Date().toISOString(),\n         a.click();\n            document.body.removeChild(a);\n            window.URL.revokeObjectURL(url);\n        }\n\n        window.onload = function() {\n            var hasData = Changes made (why):
- Removed the duplicate `exportToJSON` and kept a single export implementation so exports don‚Äôt get shadowed or diverge.  
- Deleted the stray `window.onload` that auto-exported CSV on page load to avoid unintended downloads and to rely only on the main initializer.

- Documented the session decisions in `README.md`.

function exportToJSON() {
    if (transactions.length === 0) { alert('No transactions to export!'); return; }
    var total = 0;
    for (var i = 0; i < transactions.length; i++) { total += transactions[i].amount; }
    var exportData = { exportDate: new Date().toISOString(), totalTransactions: transactions.length, totalAmount: total, transactions: transactions };
    var json = JSON.stringify(exportData, null, 2);
    var blob = new Blob([json], { type: 'application/json' });
    var url = window.URL.createObjectURL(blob);
    var a = document.createElement('a');
    a.href = url;
    a.download = 'finance-tracker-' + new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0] + '.json';
    document.body.appendChild(a);
    a.click();
    document.body.removeChild(a);
    window.URL.revokeObjectURL(url);
}

---

Here‚Äôs a quick, focused test plan (manual, no server needed since it‚Äôs a static HTML):

Core sanity
- Load `Index.html` in a browser. Confirm no auto-downloads occur on load.
- Toggle Dark Mode; refresh to ensure preference persists.

Transactions
- Add a transaction once; verify it appears exactly once and totals/statistics/charts update.
- Add another with a description; verify list order (newest first) and amounts in summary/average.
- Delete a transaction; confirm removal across list, stats, charts, budgets.

Budgets
- Set a budget for an active category; confirm it shows in the list with a progress bar.
- Spend to >80% but <100%: see ‚ÄúBudget Warning‚Äù. Spend to >100%: see ‚ÄúOver Budget‚Äù.
- Delete the budget; ensure it‚Äôs removed and alerts clear.

Filters
- Create transactions with differing timestamps (you can temporarily tweak system clock or adjust `timestamp` in devtools on an item) and verify filters All/Week/Month/Year change the displayed list, stats, charts, and budget alerts consistently.

Exports
- CSV export: download and open; confirm rows match current transactions and fields are correct.
- JSON export: open; confirm counts and totals match current state.
- PDF export: run; ensure charts and summary render, and file name matches `finance-report-YYYY-MM-DD.pdf`.

Import
- Prepare a small CSV (with and without headers) containing descriptions/amounts; import it. Verify category guessing and totals update; confirm malformed rows are skipped without crashes.

Persistence
- After adding data, refresh the page: transactions, budgets, and dark mode should persist via localStorage.

If you want, I can walk through these interactively in the built-in browser‚Äîjust confirm and let me know which cases to prioritize.

<details>
          <summary>Tool use: **mcp_desktop-commander_list_directory**</summary>
      
*Called tool*: desktop-commander - list_directory: 
                        Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path.
                        
                        Use this instead of 'execute_command' with ls/dir commands.
                        Results distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes.
                        
                        Supports recursive listing with the 'depth' parameter (default: 2):
                        - depth=1: Only direct contents of the directory
                        - depth=2: Contents plus one level of subdirectories
                        - depth=3+: Multiple levels deep
                        
                        CONTEXT OVERFLOW PROTECTION:
                        - Top-level directory shows ALL items
                        - Nested directories are limited to 100 items maximum per directory
                        - When a nested directory has more than 100 items, you'll see a warning like:
                          [WARNING] node_modules: 500 items hidden (showing first 100 of 600 total)
                        - This prevents overwhelming the context with large directories like node_modules
                        
                        Results show full relative paths from the root directory being listed.
                        Example output with depth=2:
                        [DIR] src
                        [FILE] src/index.ts
                        [DIR] src/tools
                        [FILE] src/tools/filesystem.ts
                        
                        If a directory cannot be accessed, it will show [DENIED] instead.
                        Only works within allowed directories.
                        
                        IMPORTANT: Always use absolute paths for reliability. Paths are automatically normalized regardless of slash direction. Relative paths may fail as they depend on the current working directory. Tilde paths (~/...) might not work in all contexts. Unless the user explicitly asks for relative paths, use absolute paths.
                        This command can be referenced as "DC: ..." or "use Desktop Commander to ..." in your instructions.

<tool-use data-tool-type="mcp" data-tool-name="mcp_desktop-commander_read_file">
<details>
          <summary>Tool use: **mcp_desktop-commander_read_file**</summary>
      
*Called tool*: desktop-commander - read_file: 
                        Read the contents of a file from the file system or a URL with optional offset and length parameters.
                        
                        Prefer this over 'execute_command' with cat/type for viewing files.
                        
                        Supports partial file reading with:
                        - 'offset' (start line, default: 0)
                          * Positive: Start from line N (0-based indexing)
                          * Negative: Read last N lines from end (tail behavior)
                        - 'length' (max lines to read, default: configurable via 'fileReadLineLimit' setting, initially 1000)
                          * Used with positive offsets for range reading
                          * Ignored when offset is negative (reads all requested tail lines)
                        
                        Examples:
                        - offset: 0, length: 10     ‚Üí First 10 lines
                        - offset: 100, length: 5    ‚Üí Lines 100-104
                        - offset: -20               ‚Üí Last 20 lines  
                        - offset: -5, length: 10    ‚Üí Last 5 lines (length ignored)
                        
                        Performance optimizations:
                        - Large files with negative offsets use reverse reading for efficiency
                        - Large files with deep positive offsets use byte estimation
                        - Small files use fast readline streaming
                        
                        When reading from the file system, only works within allowed directories.
                        Can fetch content from URLs when isUrl parameter is set to true
                        (URLs are always read in full regardless of offset/length).
                        
                        Handles text files normally and image files are returned as viewable images.
                        Recognized image types: PNG, JPEG, GIF, WebP.
                        
                        IMPORTANT: Always use absolute paths for reliability. Paths are automatically normalized regardless of slash direction. Relative paths may fail as they depend on the current working directory. Tilde paths (~/...) might not work in all contexts. Unless the user explicitly asks for relative paths, use absolute paths.
                        This command can be referenced as "DC: ..." or "use Desktop Commander to ..." in your instructions.

*Parameters*:
  * path: C:\Users\it\Downloads\finance-tracker-2025-12-11.csv
  * offset: 0

_**Agent (model gpt-5.1-codex-max, mode Ask)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Proposing architecture overview**

Suggest a React front end with Node.js/Express backend, PostgreSQL database, JWT-based authentication, RESTful APIs, and background jobs via a worker queue like Bull.</details></think>

---

Here‚Äôs a lean, modern full-stack architecture to take this static app to production:

- Frontend: React or Next.js (App Router), TypeScript, Tailwind for styling, Chart.js for charts. Use TanStack Query for data fetching/caching and optimistic updates.
- Backend: Node.js + Fastify (or NestJS if you want batteries-included), TypeScript, Zod for request/response validation, and a thin service layer for business logic. File uploads (CSV) handled via busboy/multer pipeline.
- Auth: Clerk/Auth0/Cognito for hosted auth, or self-hosted JWT with refresh tokens. Role-based access (user/admin) for budgets/exports.
- Data: Postgres (or MySQL) for transactions, budgets, users. Schema: `users`, `transactions` (category, amount, description, occurred_at, created_by), `budgets` (category, limit, period), `categories` (optional lookup), `imports` (status, file meta), `audit_logs`.
- APIs (REST or GraphQL): CRUD for transactions/budgets/categories; import endpoint that parses CSV server-side; export endpoints that stream CSV/JSON and on-demand PDF. Validation via Zod; errors in RFC 7807 format.
- File storage: For uploads, short-term store in S3-compatible bucket (or disk) then parse; delete after ingest. Keep original file path in `imports`.
- Background jobs: Worker (BullMQ/Redis) for CSV parsing, PDF generation, and email/export delivery. Prevents blocking API threads.
- Caching: Redis for sessions/rate limiting and to cache derived aggregates (totals per category, monthly trend). Invalidate on transaction mutations.
- Metrics/observability: pino logging, OpenTelemetry traces, Prometheus metrics, healthcheck and readiness endpoints.
- Testing: Vitest/Jest for units; Playwright/Cypress for E2E on key flows (add, delete, filter, budget alerts, exports).
- Deployment: Docker images; run Postgres+Redis in managed services; serve frontend via static hosting/CDN; backend behind an API gateway with TLS and rate limiting. CI/CD with lint/test/build on PR.

Data/format rules to preserve from current app:
- Keep ZAR currency handling; date/time stored UTC, rendered as `dd-mmm-yyyy` and 24h times on the frontend.
- No mock data in prod; seed only in dev. No fallback timestamps‚Äîuse the journal/occurred_at field as the source of truth.

If you want, I can sketch the DB schema (tables/columns) and example API contracts next.

---
