_**Agent (model gpt-5.1-codex-max, mode Ask)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Providing full-stack advice for lovable.dev**

I'm preparing concise setup and structure suggestions emphasizing priorities like data modeling, API contracts, background jobs, authentication, environment setup, testing, and migration from static to Next.js. I'll highlight specifics like handling ZAR currency, date formats, avoiding mock data, budget constraints, import pipelines, and PDF generation while noting important limitations.</details></think>

---

Here‚Äôs a concise playbook to take this into lovable.dev for a full-stack build:

- Stack choice: Next.js (App Router) with TypeScript, Tailwind, Chart.js. Backend via Next API routes or a Fastify/Nest microservice behind it; use Zod for schemas/shared types. TanStack Query on the client for data fetching/optimistic updates.
- Auth: Use a hosted provider (Clerk/Auth0/Cognito). Keep role-based gates (user/admin). Sessions in secure cookies; avoid localStorage for auth.
- Data model (Postgres): `users`; `transactions` (id, user_id, category, amount, description, occurred_at UTC, created_at, updated_at); `budgets` (id, user_id, category, limit_amount, period enum: monthly/weekly/yearly, created_at, updated_at); optional `categories` lookup; `imports` (id, user_id, status, original_filename, row_count, processed_count, created_at); `audit_logs` (who did what, when).
- Domain rules to preserve: currency ZAR; date display `dd-mmm-yyyy`, 24h time; no fallback timestamps; no mock data in prod (seed only in dev); all transactions have a real occurred_at (journal) value.
- API contracts (REST or GraphQL): 
  - `POST /transactions` (validated payload, returns transaction) 
  - `GET /transactions?from=‚Ä¶&to=‚Ä¶` (filters) 
  - `DELETE /transactions/:id`
  - `POST /budgets` / `DELETE /budgets/:id` / `GET /budgets`
  - `POST /imports` (CSV upload) ‚Üí returns import job id; `GET /imports/:id` for status
  - `GET /exports/csv|json|pdf` (streamed; respect filters)
- CSV import path: upload to S3-compatible bucket or temp disk; enqueue a worker job (BullMQ/Redis) to parse; categorize via heuristic; persist rows; emit progress; delete temp file when done.
- Exports: server-side CSV/JSON streams; PDF server-rendered (e.g., Playwright or pdfkit) to avoid html2canvas fragility. Optionally email a link to the generated export.
- Caching/aggregation: Redis for session/rate limits and caching category totals + monthly trend; invalidate on transaction mutations.
- Testing: Vitest/Jest for units; Playwright/Cypress for E2E (add/delete/filter, budget alerts, imports, exports). Include contract tests for API schemas (Zod).
- Observability: pino logging, OpenTelemetry traces, Prometheus metrics; health/readiness endpoints.
- Deployment: Dockerized; managed Postgres + Redis. Frontend via Vercel/Netlify; backend on Fly/Render/AWS/ECS. Serve over TLS; add rate limiting/WAF on the API.
- Frontend UX parity: keep filters (all/week/month/year), budgets with warning/over-budget states, dark mode, category breakdown, trend chart. Replace localStorage with API-backed state + React Query cache.
- Migrations: Use Prisma or Knex; keep seeds only for dev. Enforce NOT NULL on occurred_at and category; amount > 0 check.

If you want, I can outline Prisma models and sample request/response schemas to drop into lovable.dev.

_**Agent (model gpt-5.1-codex-max, mode Ask)**_

Below are Prisma model sketches plus Zod schemas and sample REST contracts you can paste into lovable.dev. Adjust names as needed.

Prisma models (Postgres)
```prisma
// enums
enum Period {
  WEEKLY
  MONTHLY
  YEARLY
}

// models
model User {
  id           String         @id @default(cuid())
  email        String         @unique
  displayName  String?
  role         String         @default("user")
  createdAt    DateTime       @default(now())
  updatedAt    DateTime       @updatedAt
  transactions Transaction[]
  budgets      Budget[]
  imports      Import[]
}

model Transaction {
  id          String   @id @default(cuid())
  user        User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  userId      String
  category    String
  amount      Decimal  @db.Decimal(12,2)
  description String?
  occurredAt  DateTime  // journal/source-of-truth time; no fallbacks
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
}

model Budget {
  id         String   @id @default(cuid())
  user       User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  userId     String
  category   String
  limitAmount Decimal @db.Decimal(12,2)
  period     Period
  createdAt  DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt  DateTime @updatedAt
}

model Import {
  id              String   @id @default(cuid())
  user            User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  userId          String
  originalName    String
  status          String   // e.g., pending, processing, done, failed
  rowCount        Int      @default(0)
  processedCount  Int      @default(0)
  errorMessage    String?
  createdAt       DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt       DateTime @updatedAt
}
```

Zod schemas (shared client/server)
```ts
import { z } from "zod";

export const TransactionCreateInput = z.object({
  category: z.string().min(1),
  amount: z.number().positive(),
  description: z.string().optional(),
  occurredAt: z.string().datetime(), // ISO string, UTC
});

export const TransactionResponse = TransactionCreateInput.extend({
  id: z.string(),
  userId: z.string(),
  createdAt: z.string().datetime(),
  updatedAt: z.string().datetime(),
});

export const TransactionsQuery = z.object({
  from: z.string().datetime().optional(),
  to: z.string().datetime().optional(),
});

export const BudgetCreateInput = z.object({
  category: z.string().min(1),
  limitAmount: z.number().positive(),
  period: z.enum(["WEEKLY", "MONTHLY", "YEARLY"]),
});

export const BudgetResponse = BudgetCreateInput.extend({
  id: z.string(),
  userId: z.string(),
  createdAt: z.string().datetime(),
  updatedAt: z.string().datetime(),
});

export const ImportStatus = z.object({
  id: z.string(),
  status: z.string(),
  rowCount: z.number(),
  processedCount: z.number(),
  errorMessage: z.string().nullable(),
  createdAt: z.string().datetime(),
  updatedAt: z.string().datetime(),
});
```

Sample REST contracts
- POST /transactions ‚Üí body TransactionCreateInput ‚Üí returns TransactionResponse
- GET /transactions?from&to ‚Üí returns { transactions: TransactionResponse[], total: number }
- DELETE /transactions/:id ‚Üí 204
- POST /budgets ‚Üí body BudgetCreateInput ‚Üí BudgetResponse
- GET /budgets ‚Üí { budgets: BudgetResponse[] }
- DELETE /budgets/:id ‚Üí 204
- POST /imports (multipart/form-data, file: csv) ‚Üí { id: string, status: "pending" }
- GET /imports/:id ‚Üí ImportStatus
- GET /exports/csv|json|pdf?from&to ‚Üí streamed file; honor filters

Frontend notes
- Use dd-mmm-yyyy display and 24h times; keep currency ZAR; store times in UTC and format on render.
- Replace localStorage with API + React Query cache; keep filters (all/week/month/year) as query params feeding the API.

Server notes
- Validate all payloads with Zod; return RFC 7807 error shape.
- Use Redis for rate limits and cache of aggregates; invalidate on transaction mutations.
- CSV import: upload -> job queue -> parse -> insert; delete temp file after ingest.

If you want a Next.js route handler example (App Router) for one of these endpoints, say so and I‚Äôll draft it.

The plan is t build this into a cross-platform application

---

_**Agent (model gpt-5.1-codex-max, mode Ask)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
**Recommending cross-platform architecture**

I suggest using React Native with Expo for mobile, Electron or Tauri for desktop, and React for web, all sharing a unified API and design system. Implement offline data sync with a local database (e.g., SQLite or Realm), centralized auth via OAuth/JWT, and secure storage aligned with each platform; handle packaging per environment, integrate notifications and background jobs using platform-specific APIs, leverage PDF/CSV libraries compatible across targets, manage file system access through native modules, and set environment configs via build-time variables with crash reporting centralized via a service like Sentry.</details></think>

---

Here‚Äôs a concise cross-platform plan (web, mobile, desktop) leveraging one codebase and shared backend:

- Stack choices
  - Web: Next.js (App Router) + TypeScript + Tailwind + Chart.js.
  - Mobile: React Native (Expo) sharing UI logic/state machines and API clients with web. Use a design system that maps to RN (e.g., Tamagui/NativeWind) or maintain a lightweight token system (spacing/typography/colors) shared via a config package.
  - Desktop: Tauri (lighter) or Electron if you need richer native modules. Reuse your web UI inside a desktop shell; gate native-specific APIs via an abstraction layer.
  - Shared libs: Monorepo (pnpm/turbo) with packages for types (Zod schemas), API client (fetch/React Query hooks), design tokens, and domain logic (formatting, category rules, validation).

- Backend/API
  - Node.js + Fastify/Nest; Postgres + Prisma; Redis for cache/rate limiting; BullMQ for jobs (imports, exports, email).
  - Auth: hosted (Clerk/Auth0/Cognito); use short-lived access tokens + refresh rotation; store tokens in secure storage (Keychain/Keystore) on mobile/desktop, httpOnly cookies on web.
  - Endpoints: transactions CRUD, budgets, imports (CSV upload ‚Üí job), exports (CSV/JSON/PDF stream), aggregates (category totals, trend). Keep RFC 7807 errors and Zod validation.

- Offline & sync
  - Mobile/desktop: lightweight client store (e.g., MMKV/AsyncStorage/IndexedDB) for offline queueing; tag mutations with temp IDs; reconcile on sync. Keep occurred_at as source of truth, UTC.
  - Conflict policy: last-write-wins with server timestamps; consider per-transaction version field for safe updates.

- Files/import/export
  - Imports: upload to S3-compatible storage, parse via worker; expose job status.
  - Exports: server-side CSV/JSON; PDF via Playwright/pdfkit (avoid client html2canvas). Desktop can save directly; mobile can share/save to Files.

- UI/UX parity
  - Preserve filters (all/week/month/year), budgets with warnings/over-budget states, dark mode, category breakdown, trend chart.
  - Formatting: ZAR currency, dd-mmm-yyyy dates, 24h time; no fallback timestamps; no mock data in prod.

- Packaging/distribution
  - Mobile: Expo EAS build for iOS/Android; use OTA updates cautiously (no schema changes).
  - Desktop: Tauri for Windows/macOS/Linux; code signing. Auto-update via updater service.
  - Web: deploy Next.js static+edge; API on managed hosting (Render/Fly/AWS/ECS).

- Observability & quality
  - Logging/tracing: pino + OpenTelemetry; crash reporting on mobile/desktop (Sentry/Replay).
  - Tests: Vitest/Jest units; Playwright E2E (web/desktop); Detox or Maestro for mobile; contract tests for API schemas.
  - Accessibility: keep keyboard/screen-reader parity on web/desktop; RN accessibility labels on mobile.

- Security & config
  - Secure storage for tokens; TLS everywhere; rate limits; input validation (Zod) at edge and server; CSP on web; sandbox desktop webviews.
  - Feature flags/remote config for gradual rollout; store env via secrets manager.

If you want, I can map this to a concrete monorepo layout (apps/web, apps/mobile, apps/desktop, packages/api-client, packages/ui, packages/config) and outline how to wire the shared Zod/Prisma types into all clients.

Avoid localStorage.\n- - Offline-friendly: small local store (MMKV/AsyncStorage) to queue mutations; sync when online.\n- - Keep core UX: add/delete transactions, filters, budgets, alerts, exports (JSON/CSV), and a simple chart view.\n- \n- ### Desktop (Tauri)\n- - Wrap web UI; expose native file save/open for exports.\n- - Use the same API client; keep auth in secure storage. Drop temp file after ingest.\n- - Exports: server-side streams for CSV/JSON; PDF rendered server-side (Playwright/pdfkit) to avoid html2canvas issues on clients. Desktop can save locally; mobile can share/save.\n- \n- ### Offline &amp; sync (mobile/desktop focus)\n- - Cache recent data; queue mutations with temporary IDs; reconcile on sync using server timestamps.\n- - Conflict policy: last-write-wins with server &#96;updatedAt&#96; (or use version field if needed).\n- \n- ### Caching &amp; performance\n- - Redis for rate limits and caching aggregates (category totals, monthly trends). Invalidate on transaction changes.\n- - Use pagination for history; keep dashboard endpoints summarized.\n- \n- ### Testing\n- - Unit: Vitest/Jest for logic and API handlers.\n- - Contract: Zod schema tests for request/response.\n- - E2E: Playwright (web/desktop), Detox/Maestro (mobile).\n- - Integration: seed Postgres test DB; run migrations in CI.\n- \n- ### Deployment\n- - Build once, deploy:\n-   - Web: Vercel/Netlify (static + edge) or any CDN.\n-   - Backend: Render/Fly/AWS/GCP; Postgres managed; Redis managed.\n-   - Mobile: Expo EAS to App Store/Play Store.\n-   - Desktop: Tauri builds for Win/macOS/Linux with code signing.\n- - Dockerize backend; run migrations on deploy.
